# criblio_secret (Resource)

Secret Resource

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "criblio_secret" "my_secret" {
  description = "API key for ingestion service"
  group_id    = "default"
  id          = "sec-3f7a2c9d"
  secret_type = "text"
  tags        = "env:prod,team:security"
  value       = "token-abc123"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `group_id` (String) The consumer group to which this instance belongs. Defaults to 'default'.
- `id` (String) Unique ID to PATCH
- `secret_type` (String) must be one of ["text", "keypair", "credentials"]

### Optional

- `description` (String)
- `tags` (String)
- `value` (String)

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

In Terraform v1.5.0 and later, the [`import` block](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/import) can be used with the `id` attribute, for example:

```terraform
import {
  to = criblio_secret.my_criblio_secret
  id = jsonencode({
    group_id = "default"
    id = "secret-s3"
  })
}
```

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import criblio_secret.my_criblio_secret '{"group_id": "default", "id": "secret-s3"}'
```
